oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from George Jones, CSA, to his family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jones wrote this letter at Vicksburg, Mississippi, to his brother Charles Patton Jones and Charles's wife, Polly. He noted Union and Confederate troop numbers and movement, and listed the prices of items like flour, sugar, meat, and boots. George Washington Jones was from the Kendrick's Creek area near Kingsport, and possibly served in the 39th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA or the 60th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA (Crawford's Regiment, 79th Tenn. Inf." Jones died in 1865.
